intro: Epidendrum paniculatum var. cuspidatum, commonly known as the spike epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its long, pendulous inflorescences that bear clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a compact rosette. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements in cultivation.
